posts.description:
Collaborating with @toddhannigan, @fernieapodaca and Jon Swift on the score for the "Offseason" and "Beyond the Offseason" films was a dream come true and also a bit of a full circle experience for me. 
Each of them had played on my favorite 16mm surf movie soundtracks (such as Shelter and Thicker Than Water) years ago, when those films both influenced my career and were how I discovered new music. 
@jackjohnson, the filmmaker behind Thicker Than Water, was also kind enough to let us use one of his tracks for the credits of the #Offseason_film. 
Read more about scoring the films and my road trips with @danielnorris18, and also a Spotify link for the soundtrack in the article linked in my profile. Swipe for more images!

For the past two years @tigers pitcher @danielnorris18 and I have taken a van road trip during his off season, while making two short films "Offseason" and "Beyond the Offseason." I wrote a little piece for @yeti and shared some images from our trip to Ventura this past fall--link in my profile. #Offseason_film

Kris Tompkins

@huachopup is a tireless conservationist, founder of @conservacionpatagonica, former founding CEO of @patagonia, and one of the most generous and inspiring spirits I have had the opportunity to meet. This portrait is from last year at @mountainfilm where I was struck by the positivity and resilience that Kris seemed to radiate, especially after the recent loss of her husband Doug, her partner both in life and in the incredible conservation work they accomplished.

Her grit and tenacity was made even more evident earlier this month when after 25 years of effort, Kris negotiated with the Chilean government and President Michelle Bachelet to commit ten acres towards protected national parks for every acre of land donated by @tompkins_conservation. With Kris's donation of 1 million acres‚Äîthe largest private donation of land for conservation in history(!)‚Äîan additional 10 million acres will be protected, resulting in over 11 million acres over five new national parks in Chilean Patagonia. Thank you Kris for leading by example! .
A great article in The Guardian on this historic conservation event:
bit.ly/tompkinsconservation
.
To find out even more about Kris's efforts, visit: 
conservacionpatagonica.org
tompkinsconservation.org
.
#moon_faces #bwportrait #wildlegacy #kristompkins #patagonia #180south

Winter in the Pacific Northwest can sometimes feel like a self-imposed punishment, but those endless rainy days can also be an opportunity for immense growth. 
After this particularly intense season of transition and reflection, I fully welcome the shift to spring, and also the fresh perspective that the storms instilled.
.
I shot this handheld at 1/10th of a second, testing the stabilized sensor on the new Sony a6500 (with the Sony/Zeiss 16-35mm f4 ) #sonyalpha

Last week I had the opportunity to sit down for an interview with @stovallstudio and @bankercinefoto for their @visualrevolutionary podcast. 
These guys have featured many of my creative heroes and peers, and I enjoy how their discussions focus on each individual's back story.

We went way back in this one... give a listen and let me know if you have any thoughts or questions! 
Go to visualrevolutionary.com or find it in your Podcasts or Stitcher app.
___

via Visual Revolutionary:

On this episode of the podcast we have the opportunity to sit down for an inspiring conversation with photographer, filmmaker, adventure lover, and cancer survivor @ben_moon.

Make sure to check us out at üëâüèºvisualrevolutionary.comüëàüèº Many of you know Ben from his heartfelt short film "Denali", that chronicled the last days of his dog that had been with him through so much of his life, and became a viral sensation and an award winning piece on the film festival circuit. 
Although that film definitely helped push Ben onto the national stage, he had already built a career and a lifestyle that many would admire, working with companies like @patagonia and shooting music videos and photos for several well known musicians. 
During our talk we get the chance to ask Ben what it was like creating a film that dealt with so many personal issues, how he created his newest piece "Offseason" for @yeti, featuring his road trip with MLB pitcher and fellow photography lover Daniel Norris @danielnorris18 , and hear about his battle with cancer and how he stayed positive and motivated to beat the odds and return to the life of adventure he loved. 
So sit back, listen, and be ready to be inspired from our conversation with Ben Moon.
___

#DenaliFilm #Offseason_film #SonyAlpha

Keith Malloy

@thetorpedopeople is a badass waterman, director, father, songwriter, and all around #legend.
.
I first met Keith in 2005 during his veggie oil fueled #BendtoBaja adventure, while I was in an especially heavy period of chemo infusions. Rock climbing and camping with him during that time was a welcome lift of my spirits, a mood that was captured (as seen at 02:18 into the #DenaliFilm) in an image of Keith and I where I'm throwing a especially stoked double shaka.
.
Keith's film ‚ÄúCome Hell or High Water‚Äù gave voice to the often overlooked crew of bodysurfers, and his latest film project "FishPeople" promises to be equally entertaining and insightful. Recently he also directed the excellent short ‚ÄúBruhwiler Country" for @yeti and was featured in another Yeti film, "The Malloy Brothers."
.
I could write a lot more about Keith, but for sake of keeping it short... if you don't know, just google the guy.
.
stories.yeti.com/story/bruhwiler
stories.yeti.com/story/malloy-brothers
.
#moon_faces #bwportrait #KeithMalloy #humblebadass #torpedopeople #FishPeople #180south
.
* shot on the Sony #a7RII using my favorite portrait lens, the 85mm 1.4 #SonyGmaster  #SonyAlpha

Throwback to the first morning of a five week road trip through Norway, when we became fully aware that four people exceeded the sleeping capacity of our little camper van. #notopbunk #whopackedthetent #TheNorwagon
üì∑: @63mph

Three years ago today I said goodbye to Denali, who was a steady friend through his 14 1/2 years at my side. Instead of feeling sadness, I am grateful for all that I learned during those formative years, and now have come to understand that our canine companions continue to teach us long after they've passed on.

I'm especially thankful for the #DenaliFilm (link in profile) that both honors his memory and shares a more universal message of overcoming difficult times with the help of our friends. I have so much gratitude to the incredible crew who helped bring the film to life.

The thousands of heartfelt emails I received after we first shared the film have given me a lot to think about, and I‚Äôve realized that there is a lot more to share about my time with Denali and our battles with cancer. For the past year I have been working on a book proposal on the subject, and though a bit daunting, I am looking forward to diving into the Denali's story with a fresh perspective.

I believe this image was shot on either Velvia 50 or Provia 100, my two go-to film choices back in the days of slides and light tables.

Renan Ozturk 
@renan_ozturk is a brilliant filmmaker, painter, and photographer with a phenomenal eye who is continually innovating in his many crafts. Possessed with a particularly advanced form of ‚ÄúFOMAS‚Äù aka ‚ÄúFear Of Missing A Shot‚Äù, he is most at home pushing through uncomfortable situations until he‚Äôs satisfied his vision.

Also an accomplished climber, Renan climbed Meru via the intimidating Shark's Fin route with @conrad_anker and @jimmy_chin in 2011, as seen in the #merufilm documentary.

I first became familiar with Renan and his work over a decade ago, while we were both in the early years of our artistic endeavors, rock climbing and living the dirtbag lifestyle. It's been fun to witness his creative trajectory since then, and today he's often dreaming up new projects with the @camp4collective crew, or collaborating and playing in the mountains with his awesome wife @taylorfreesolo and their husky pup @baloointhewild.

renanozturk.com

#moon_faces #bwportrait #RenanOzturk #SonyArtisan #SonyAlpha #artist #FOMAS * shot on the Sony #a7RII and 85mm 1.4 #SonyGmaster lens

Amidst the darkness, every sunset offers hints of the coming dawn...
the simpler life, somewhere in Baja
